ObjTextEntries.textEntry: In 1955 the General Services Administration loaned 14 mural designs to the University of Maryland.  Also during the 50's a number of works were retrieved from a "trash pile" that were in a now demolished government building.  In 1973 a little over a hundred works were transfered to the GSA to be restored.  GSA gave a number of works to the National Collection of Fine Arts (Currently the National Museum of American Art) and 26 pieces to the Baltimore Museum for exhibition. At this point a dispute began regarding ownership.  In 1974 an agreement was made stating the National Collection of Fine Art would loan the works to the University of Maryland on an indefinite basis.
